sen.j: 奈良豆比古神社（ならつひこじんじゃ）は、奈良県奈良市にある神社である。
sen.e: Naratu hiko-jinja Shrine is located in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
Naratu hiko-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
Naratu hiko-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: かつては奈良坂春日社と称していた。
sen.e: It used to be named Narasaka Kasugasha.
It used to be named Narasaka Kasugasha.
It used to be named Narasaka Kasugasha.

sen.j: 式内社「大和国添上郡 奈良豆比古神社」の後裔社である。
sen.e: This shrine descends from shikinaisha (a shrine listed on Engishiki Jinmyocho compiled in 927), 'Naratsu hiko-jinja Shrine in Soekami-gun Yamato no kuni (Yamato Province) Soekami-gun'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The shrine descends from the shikinaisha (a shrine listed on Engishiki Jinmyocho compiled in 927), 'Naratsu hiko-jinja Shrine in Soekami-gun Yamato no kuni (Yamato Province) Soekami-gun'.
The shrine descends from the shikinaisha (a shrine listed on Engishiki Jinmyocho compiled in 927), 'Naratsu hiko-jinja Shrine in Soekami-gun Yamato no kuni (Yamato Province) Soekami-gun'.

sen.j: （天理市の楢神社を奈良豆比古神社の後裔社とする説もあるが、あまり有力視されていない）。
sen.e: (There is another view that Nara-jinja Shrine in Tenri City is considered to be Naratsu hiko-jinja Shrine, but this view is not convincing.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is another view that Nara-jinja Shrine in Tenri City is Naratsu hiko-jinja Shrine, but this is not likely.
There is another view that Nara-jinja Shrine in Tenri City is Naratsu hiko-jinja Shrine, but this is not likely.
Enshrined gods
Enshrined gods
Enshrined deities

sen.j: 中殿に平城津比古大神（当地の産土神、奈良豆比古神とも）。
sen.e: Heijotsuhiko Okami (ubusunakami or a god that owns and protects its land in the region and it was also called Naratsu hiko no kami) is enshrined in chuden (between the main hall and the worshippers' hall).

Heijotsuhiko Okami (ubusunakami or a god that owns and protects its land in the region and it was also called Naratsu hiko no kami) is enshrined in the chuden (between the main hall and the worship hall).

Heijotsuhiko Okami (ubusunakami or a god that owns and protects its land in the region and it was also called Naratsu hiko no kami) is enshrined in the chuden (between the main hall and the worship hall).

sen.j: 左殿に春日宮天皇（施基親王、志貴皇子、田原天皇とも）を祀る。
sen.e: On the left side of chuden, the Emperor Kasuganomiya (other names were Kishi no miko,施基親王 or 志貴皇子 and the Emperor Tahara) is enshrined.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 「施基親王、志貴皇子」の読み方が同じなので、「Kishi no miko,施基親王 or 志貴皇子 」としました。
sen.e: Emperor Kasuganomiya (also called Shiki Shinno, Shiki no Miko and the Emperor Tahara) is enshrined in the saden (left space).
Emperor Kasuganomiya (also called Shiki Shinno, Shiki no Miko and the Emperor Tahara) is enshrined in the saden (left space).

sen.j: また、右殿には春日王（志貴皇子の子）を祀る。
sen.e: On the right side of chuden, Kasugao (Prince of Kishi no miko) is enshrined.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kasugao (Prince of Kishi no miko) is enshrined in the uden (right space)
Kasugao (Prince of Kishi no miko) is enshrined in the uden (right space)

sen.j: ただし、『式内社考』では中殿が南良春日宮大神（奈良豆比古神）、左殿が春日大社若宮（天押雲根命）、右殿が矢幡大神（施基親王）としている。
sen.e: However, "shikinaishako" described that Nanryo Kasuganomiya Okami (Naratsu hiko no kami) was enshrimed in chuden and Kasuga taisha wakamiya (Ame no oshikumone no mikoto) was enshrined on the left side and Yahata Okami (Kishi no miko) was enshrined on the right side.
sen.cmt: 「南良春日宮大神」の読み不明のため、Nanryo Kasuganomiya Okami to としました。
sen.e: However, "Shikinaishako" states that Nanryo Kasuganomiya Okami (Naratsu hiko no kami) was enshrined in the chuden, Kasuga taisha wakamiya (Ame no oshikumone no mikoto) is enshrined oin the saden Yahata Okami (Kishi no miko) is enshrined in the uden.

However, "Shikinaishako" states that Nanryo Kasuganomiya Okami (Naratsu hiko no kami) was enshrined in the chuden, Kasuga taisha wakamiya (Ame no oshikumone no mikoto) is enshrined oin the saden Yahata Okami (Kishi no miko) is enshrined in the uden.
History
History
History

sen.j: 当地は、光仁天皇の父の施基親王（春日宮天皇）が病気療養のために隠居していた奈良山春日離宮の地である。
sen.e: This was the place in which Narayama Kasuga Rkyu (Narayama Kasuga Imperial Villa) where the Emperor Konin's father, the Imperial Prince Kishi (the Emperor Kasuga no miya) stayed after his retirement to recuperate for his health was located.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Naratsu hiko-jinja Shrine site is the location of the former Narayama Kasuga Rkyu (Narayama Kasuga Imperial Villa) where the Emperor Konin's father, Imperial Prince Kishi (Emperor Kasuga no Miya) stayed after his retirement to recuperate.

The Naratsu hiko-jinja Shrine site is the location of the former Narayama Kasuga Rikyu (Narayama Kasuga Imperial Villa) where the Emperor Konin's father, Imperial Prince Kishi (Emperor Kasuga no Miya) stayed after his retirement to recuperate.

sen.j: 宝亀2年（771年）、その地に施基親王を祀ったのに始まる。
sen.e: In 771, the Imperial Prince Kishi was enshrined in this place, which was the beginning of the shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The shrine came into being in 771 when Imperial Prince Kishi was enshrined at the site.
The shrine came into being in 771 when Imperial Prince Kishi was enshrined at the site.
Rites and Festivals
Rites and Festivals
Rites and Festivals

sen.j: 奈良豆比古神社の翁舞は、2000年12月27日に重要無形民俗文化財に指定された。
sen.e: Okinamai (the origin of Noh) demonstrated in Naratsu hiko-jinja Shrine was designated a significant intangible folk cultural asset in December 27, 2000.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Okinamai (the origin of Noh) performed at Naratsu hiko-jinja Shrine was designated an Important Intangible Folk Cultural Property on December 27, 2000.
Okinamai (the origin of Noh) performed at Naratsu hiko-jinja Shrine was designated an Important Intangible Folk Cultural Property on December 27, 2000.

sen.j: この翁舞は、毎年10月8日夜、秋の例祭の宵宮に町内の翁講中によって奈良豆比古神社に奉納されるものである。
sen.e: Okinamai is the dedicated dance presented by Okinakochu, a neighborhood association in Naratsu hiko-jinja Shrine on the eve of the festival which annually falls on the night of October 8.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Okinamai is dedicated by the town Okina association to Naratsu hiko-jinja Shrine every year on the night of October 8th, the eve of the autumn festival.
Okinamai is dedicated by the town Okina association to Naratsu hiko-jinja Shrine every year on the night of October 8th, the eve of the autumn festival.
